title: Real Estate Social Media Content & Engagement Manager
description:
**Social Media Content & Engagement Manager**

**Join the Pioneers of tech-enabled real estate services at Transactly**

At Transactly, we’re more than just a service provider; we're pioneers shaping the future of how real estate transactions work. Our team is on a mission to be the platform of choice for the people and companies involved in real estate transactions. Our online platform shortens the amount of time it takes to coordinate a real estate transaction through a mix of automation, integrations, and tech-enabled services. Our customers are top real estate professionals, companies, and investors across the US.

We live and operate daily by our team’s core values: Take Ownership, Embrace Transparency, Have Mettle, Drive Engagement, and Be Agile.

**We’re looking for someone who can be the driving force in developing and executing core brand strategies in the social space by:**

* Leading social media strategy, development and execution across various social platforms including, but not limited to; Facebook, Instagram, X, YouTube, TikTok, etc.
* Coordinating and developing video, infographics, and other creative content
* Collaborating with other partners and influencers to drive engagement and brand awareness

The ideal candidate will be a clear, confident communicator with deep digital experience, with demonstrated results, and a 'data-driven' focus.

**What We’re Seeking:**

* 3+ years years experience in social media, and/or digital marketing
* 2+ years in the proptech and/or the residential real estate industry
* Knowledgeable and experienced with AI prompt engineering (GPT, Midjourney, or other content creating AI)

**What We’re Offering**

* Competitive and attractive compensation: $55k to $70k starting salary
* Remote Flexibility: Work from anywhere with our fully remote setup.
* Comprehensive benefits package including health, dental, & vision insurance, 401(k) with company match, wellness incentives, and generous PTO.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Supplemental pay types:

* Bonus opportunities

Work Location: Remote

title: Product Marketing Manager (Remote)
description:
**WHO WE ARE**



Parse Biosciences is a global life sciences company whose mission is to accelerate progress in human health and scientific research. Empowering researchers to perform single cell sequencing with unprecedented scale and ease, our pioneering approach has enabled groundbreaking discoveries in cancer treatment, tissue repair, stem cell therapy, kidney and liver disease, brain development, and the immune system.



Founded based on a transformative technology invented at the University of Washington, Parse has raised over $100 million and is used by over 1,000 labs across the world. Our growing portfolio of products includes Evercode Whole Transcriptome, Evercode TCR, Gene Capture, and a software tool for data analysis.



Parse Biosciences is based in Seattle, Washington's vibrant South Lake Union district, where we recently opened a 34,000 square foot headquarters and state-of-the-art laboratory.


**THE POSITION**



The **Product Marketing Manager** will be responsible for developing and communicating product messaging to inform existing and potential customers. This role will focus on planning and creating collateral that delivers compelling messaging around the company's portfolio. This role will involve collaborating with product management and R&D to produce content that is informed by customer perspective and technical product knowledge. Candidates should be organized, with a strong scientific background and a storyteller's flair. The ideal candidate is excited about the field of single-cell genomics and invigorated by working together across a multi-functional team.


**IN THIS POSITION, YOU WILL:**


* Create content for omni-channel marketing efforts in support of the product portfolio and new product initiatives with an eye toward segment-specific value propositions, market benchmarks, and product differentiation
* Target positioning and messaging relevant to customer segment and buyer journey stage
* Develop marketing personas, customer segmentation strategies, customer journeys, and key messaging
* Manage the collateral calendar, creation of supporting elements, and review efforts
* Collaborate with branding, design, technical writing, public relations, and search engine optimization experts for high impact campaigns and materials
* Collaborate with Product Managers to develop effective messaging and product campaigns
* Stay up-to-date on advances in single-cell genomics, company technology, and the broader competitive landscape


**FOR THIS POSITION, WE LOOK FOR**


* Bachelor's degree in life sciences or related discipline
* 3+ years of relevant experience in product marketing, product management, or customer application support in genomics, with preference for experience in field of single cell sequencing
* A proactive attitude with the ability to work both independently and collaboratively with a team
* Ability to communicate clearly to a technical audience (both written and verbal)
* Strong time management and organizational skills, with a proven ability to meet deadlines


*Parse Biosciences is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other status protected by federal, state, or local law.*


*COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement: Parse Biosciences has a COVID-19 vaccination policy that applies to all employees regardless of work location, except as prohibited by applicable law. As such, newly hired employees are required to be fully vaccinated prior to commencing employment, subject to reasonable accommodation and other requirements of applicable federal, state, and local law. Being fully vaccinated means that an individual is at least two weeks past their final (or only) dose of an authorized COVID-19 vaccine regimen. Exemptions will be considered for medical conditions/disabilities and sincerely held religious beliefs, observations, or practices.*

title: Social Media Manager (PHX)
description:
***Who we are:***


bread & Butter is a full-service communications agency with a fondness for all things food, drink and travel. We are a collaborative group of dreamers and do-ers. We combine intimate local knowledge with an extensive national network to craft clever and multidisciplinary communications campaigns tailored to our clients’ needs. We only partner with inventive businesses that inspire us and continually challenge us to think big, but act small.

***Why bread & Butter:***


We are Southerners at heart, always saying, “Please” and “Thank You,” and hustlers by trade. We believe everyone deserves a seat at the table and practice what we preach to ensure the spirit of hospitality runs through everything we do. We're not a company that wastes time—not yours, not ours. We are not too busy to talk, come by or think of new ways to increase long-term brand awareness. For us, there is little difference between work and pleasure because our work is our pleasure.

***We’re Looking at You!***


A Social Media Manager with bread & Butter is a digital whiz kid, go-getter, and many-hat wearer who is ready to roll up your sleeves and get to work. You can’t get enough social, whether it’s following the top foodie influencers, keeping up with the latest digital trends or trying the latest TikTok trend. You’re also obsessed with restaurants, wine, food products, destinations and hotels and most likely have been a waiter, front desk clerk, line cook or oenophile in a past life. You are the account dynamo, helping meet client goals by crafting a social media voice and channeling brand sentiment to build authentic, relevant, interactive conversations and relationships. A proverbial eager beaver, you meet or beat deadlines, stay ahead of trends and always look for a new way to skin a cat. You like to go big – because going home isn’t an option. You’re learning to be a problem solver and you value the relationships you’re building with client communities. A Social Media Manager for bread & Butter should be thoughtful, creative, a strong writer, possess an almost obsessive attention to detail and is the first to get in the mix when helping means the chance to learn more.

***Available Opportunity:***


A Social Media Manager for bread & Butter is responsible for managing the online platforms of 6+ clients on a daily basis. A Social Media Manager will serve as a representative of the company and works in tandem with PR and influencer marketing team, overseeing a Digital Coordinator and or Digital Engagement Manager. reporting to a Social Media Strategist or Digital Account Director.

***Here’s What We Need:***

* BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience
* 3-5 years relevant experience in social media management and/or social media marketing.
* Extensive knowledge of Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, TikTok, Pinterest, LinkedIn, YouTube and other relevant social media networks.
* Experience with launching social campaigns for hotels, restaurants, food personalities and/or CPG food and beverage brands.
* Background in creative development, social media analytics tools, and campaign analysis.
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, prioritizing and handling multiple projects.
* Ability to peer and self-edit writing quickly, turning around social media posts in real time.
* Ability to identify strategic and creative social media collaborations, takeovers and promotions for brands and lead through steps to execute.
* Ability to exercise sound judgement, responding to consumers and guests within a brand’s voice during daily community management practices.
* Media junkie - there’s no such thing as reading/watching too much. Bonus points for pop culture acumen.
* Love of a fast-paced environment and the satisfaction of a busy yet productive day.
* Flexibility and a desire for endless possibilities. b&B is a dynamic, ever-evolving company that thinks beyond black and white.
* Excitement for growth, new ideas, new ways of doing things and a place you’re excited to call home. Say yes!

***Having Our Cake & Eating it Too:***

* We offer unlimited vacation, generous maternity, family planning and personal leave, work from home, Endless Summer Fridays and time off for important events like birthdays and parent-teacher conferences.
* We offer 401k, new business bonuses and a generous employee referral program.
* We love celebrating, whether it’s Wine Wednesday or just Tuesday. We always enjoy an excuse to raise a glass.
* Learning something new is our jam. We try to say, “Yes!” and we’ll figure it out. We offer extensive training, opportunities to expand your skillset and the ability to work in any office across the country.
* We want you to be healthy – mentally, spiritually and physically. We offer generous medical, dental, and vision insurance, as well as the flexibility that comes with being a “little big” company.

***Compensation:*** 60-75K annually in addition to medical, dental, vision, 401K, life, cell phone reimbursement and unlimited vacation.

title: Marketing Consultant (Social Media, Content, Communications)
description:
Journey Clinical is on a mission to transform the growing mental health crisis by accelerating the adoption of frontier treatments that lead to lasting improvements in clinical outcomes. We have built a turnkey healthtech platform to safely and effectively expand access to a powerful modality known as Psychedelic-Assisted Psychotherapy, starting with Ketamine-Assisted Psychotherapy (KAP). In our patient-centered collaborative care model, licensed psychotherapists in the network take on the psychotherapy, while Journey Clinical's in-house medical team takes on patient eligibility, treatment plan and outcome monitoring. Our platform gives psychotherapists passionate about PAP the infrastructure and support required to become empowered KAP providers, while enabling higher standards of patient care and enhanced clinical outcomes.  

We have recently closed a successful Series A round led by Union Square Ventures, and are backed by a number of top-tier investors including AlleyCorp, Fifty Years, Able Partners, Gaingels, Palo Santo, PsyMed Ventures, Coalition Operators, Christina Sass co-founder of Andela, Edvard Engesæth, MD co-founder of Nurx and, Hans Gangeskar co-founder of Nurx.  

We are building an open-minded and inclusive workplace where you will have the opportunity to grow and collaborate with a diverse team of high performing individuals. Our team combines extensive experience in business and healthcare. We are mission driven and strive to make the workplace stimulating, ethical, rewarding, and fun. Together, we will be working at the cutting edge of a groundbreaking field that is reshaping mental health and we will make a direct impact on people’s lives.### **Responsibilities**

* Own our content calendar and social media content across all platforms (LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, etc)
* Maintain website content & blog
* Support company communications initiatives

### **Requirements**

* 3-5 years of content marketing and social media experience
* Experience building social media content calendars, growing audiences & driving engagement
* Strong written communication skills
* Ability to work 30-40 hours per week
* Proficiency with graphic design & video editing platforms (Canva, Adobe Illustrator, Veed, etc)
* Self starter comfortable with ambiguity
* Healthtech experience and passion for psychedelics is a plus!

### **Benefits**

* $45-$55/hr
* Opportunity to evolve this role into a full-time position later this year for the right candidate


We recognize healthcare is a universal concern and tackling the mental health crisis will require team members with different strengths from all walks of life. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and consider applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetics or any other basis forbidden under federal, state, or local law.  

If you feel discouraged by the job description because your skills don’t exactly match please apply anyway. We likely missed something and are open to expanding our understanding of the role. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and consider applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetics or any other basis forbidden under federal, state, or local law.

title: Programmatic Media Manager
description:
#### **Who We Are**


**Goodway Group is AdAge's 2023's BEST PLACE TO WORK**! As an independent and remote-first media and marketing services firm with a 90+ year history, Goodway Group has the security of an established company combined with a start-up feel. With leading data-driven and technology-enabled digital media and marketing services firm with teams in the U.S. and the UK, our diverse team of digital strategists, media practitioners, technologists and data scientists have won the most prestigious awards for innovative marketing technology, impactful work and inclusive remote-first places to work including being honored as a multiyear winner in Ad Age Best Places to Work, Ad Exchanger's Best Use of Technology by an Agency Award and two MarTech Breakthrough Awards and a certified service partner to The Trade Desk.
The **Programmatic Media Manager** is responsible for tactical execution excellence and accountable for tactical plan delivery. They strategically plan, activate, optimize, and manage programmatic media buys aligned with the communication strategy, customer journey, and audience insights. They are responsible for ensuring effective media activation while considering the client's business goals and objectives. The Programmatic Media Manager works closely with clients, collaborating with them to develop comprehensive media activation plans and presenting campaign analysis and insights to address their concerns


**What You'll Do**


* Oversee ongoing optimization and day-to-day activities for Programmatic campaigns to meet campaign goals, including bid management, budget allocation, forecasting, performance monitoring, strategic testing, campaign expansion, business review, etc.
* Knowledge and experience in third-party ad servers and DSPs, such as **Google Campaign Manager 360, Google Display & Video 360 (DV360) & The Trade Desk.**
* Understand **end-to-end campaign execution** (setup, optimization, insights, reporting, and billing) across programmatic.
* Maintain structured **naming taxonomy** for all elements within the ad server including campaigns, packages, placements, ads, and creatives, in alignment with Goodway Best Practices/Standards.
* Preferred background in modeling & forecasting campaigns, but must have experience in data analysis & visualization, including Google Analytics, visual data platforms such as Google Data Studios, SKAI (formally, Kenshoo), and Tableau (SQL knowledge is a plus).
* Have a familiarity with direct response goals, including CPL, CAC, CLV, lead-to-sale ratio, etc.
* Media Solutions team members must have general knowledge in the following areas:
	+ **Strategy**: Solid understanding of marketing objectives, pixel strategy, and how different channels & tactics influence consumer behaviors.
	+ **Campaign & Tech Savvy**: Knowledge of platform campaign flow – including creative development/acquisition, setup/trafficking, trading, troubleshooting, reporting, and billing in multiple platforms.
	+ **Data Analytics:** Dive into daily campaign metrics to find audience insights that can be applied across channels, maximizing performance, and future recommendations as well as drive data storytelling.
	+ **Strong Communicator**: Ability to translate strategy, data, and technical set-up requirements with clients, then make sure reporting packages up results in a meaningful way.

**Who You Are**


* *An Expert:* You have spent **3+ years** in trading on major accounts within high volume, multi-location, and/or multi-market campaigns.
* *A Student:* Willingness and **desire to understand** all functions and channels of the media solutions team.
* *Multi-Faceted*: Can **zoom in** to the campaign level and **zoom out** to the client-centric perspective. Comfortable with client communication and engagement.
* *Resourceful*: Understand how to leverage the necessary tools and resources to come up with new or creative solutions.
* *Problem Solver*: You love to **problem solve**, as well as the ability to collaborate cross-functionally.
* *Innovative*: You are eager to **test and learn**. You can articulate what you expect to happen as the output of a plan and **actively seek to make improvements** to existing campaign plans and **consistently connect** with team members to understand what is performing or not.
* *Organized:* You're able to effectively **manage multiple things**, competing priorities, and several requests at one time, through intentional **time management** and good **prioritization**.


**Things You Should Know**


* Twice per year, we gather together to work and play for a week. Both retreats are "can't miss" events. There may also be other opportunities to travel depending on your specific role and business needs.

**Check us out at** **www.goodwaygroup.com** **to learn more!**


**If you identify as a female candidate, and feel you can do this role even if there are a few things perhaps you've not done, please apply anyway! Goodway Group is 70% Female!** We realize that men tend to apply for jobs when they can meet around 60% of the requirements for the role, where women tend to only apply when they know they meet 100% of the requirements.



Goodway Group is human-first, constantly working to become more inclusive and to make sure our employee population reflects our desire to constantly add to our diversity in all ways. We want applications from **everyone**, regardless of race, creed, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, marital status, citizen status, age, disability, military or protected veteran status, genetic predisposition or carrier status or any other legally protected status. #usremote

title: Social Media Coordinator

ob Overview:

If you are a creative thinker with a passion for social media marketing, we would love to hear from you. Apply today to join our dynamic team!

**Corporate Overview**: World Food Championships Holdings (WFCH) is a partnership with  
Endeavor/IMG aimed at growing The World Food Championships (WFC) into a global powerhouse of food sport events, television derivatives, consumer products, licensing, merchandising and talent management. Essentially, American Idol for Food.

WFC is the highest-stakes Food Sports competition in the world. This multi-day, live event culinary competition showcases some of the world's best cooks who compete for food, fame and fortune in 12 categories (Bacon, Barbecue, Burger, Chef, Cocktail, Dessert, Live Fire,  
Rice/Noodle, Sandwich, Seafood, Soup and Vegetarian). Each year as Food Sport kicks off in  
January, thousands of cook teams try to earn their way into WFC by winning a Golden Ticket at an official qualifier. Almost 40 countries and every state in America have been represented at  
WFC’s main event since its inception in 2012.

The World Mixology Championships also debuted at the WFC 2023 event and will be a significant corporate focus in the coming years.

title: Marketing Account Manager (Remote)
description:
**Join the Jairus Marketing Adventure!** **Account Manager Wanted!**

  

We’re looking for someone with **marketing agency experience** to join our team! *Applicants not meeting this requirement will not be considered for the position.* Please be sure your resume reflects the agencies you have worked with.

  

On your resume or cover letter, we want to see examples of the following:


* Experience managing multiple (8-10) clients using multiple marketing channels.
* A track record of delivering projects on/ahead of schedule.
* Your comfort level in a fast-paced environment.
* Experience pulling data out of/editing at least one of the industry-leading CRMs (Salesforce, HubSpot, Marketo).

  


*Please note: Applicants that do not meet these requirements will not be considered for the position.*

  

**The Role: Account Manager**



As an integral part of our Client Success team, Account Managers are the vital link between our clients and our internal fulfillment team. Working in collaboration with Jairus Account Directors, you'll play a key role in executing client strategy, ensuring project excellence, and nurturing client relationships.

  

**Responsibilities:**


* **Strategic Execution Support:** Assist Account Directors in executing client strategy and delivering SOW on time and at the expected quality and quantity.
* **Process Expertise:** Understand and follow internal processes and workflows, utilizing project management systems to ensure timely and budget-friendly client work delivery.
* **Digital Platform Proficiency:** Be familiar with social/digital platforms, advertising platforms, CRMs, and email platforms to support client SOW execution.
* **Onboarding Wizard:** Facilitate new client onboarding efforts in collaboration with support team members.
* **Relationship Building:** Develop and maintain strong relationships with key accounts, participating in strategy and performance discussions to optimize client performance.
* **Results Reporting:** Adhere to results reporting SOPs, working with Account Directors to analyze and report metrics to clients.

  


**✨** **Requirements:**


* **Project Management Prowess:** Ability to manage multiple projects, deadlines, and changing priorities.
* **Client Relationship Guru:** Strong ability to build and maintain relationships with clients.
* **Communication Maestro:** Excellent communication and negotiation skills.
* **Project Brief Virtuoso:** Ability to gather information and assemble project briefs for presentation to internal teams.
* **Leadership Star:** Possess leadership qualities and the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* **Healthcare Enthusiast:** Experience with healthcare clients is a plus!
* **Startup Spirit:** Eager to work in a fast-paced startup environment with many opportunities to grow and learn.
* **Speed Enthusiast:** Thrives in a fast-paced environment, making quick decisions without sacrificing quality.
* **Experienced Expert:** At least 2 years experience in a full service digital marketing agency specializing in B2B services.

  



**Jairus Marketing's Core Values:**


* **Christ-Driven:** Although it's not mandatory for our team to hold specific faith traditions, we're dedicated to steering the ship of our organization with the lively spirit of Christian principles like the Golden Rule *(Matthew 7:12)* and a Commitment to Excellence *(Colossians 3:23)*.
* **Committed to Excellence:** Our work matters, weaving magic that positively impacts others' well-being. People count on us for amazing things, and we're here to honor that request!
* **Team Dedication:** Marketing is a team sport—help your teammates, ask for help, and let's win together!
* **Continuous Improvement:** Stay at the forefront of the dynamic marketing terrain—strive to outshine yesterday and elevate our client service game!
* **Ambiguity Masters:** Navigate the gray zones of marketing with discernment and make informed decisions with limited information.

  



️ **Meet Our CEO:**



Curious about who we are and why we do what we do? Check out this video from our CEO: https://bit.ly/3IlMMru

 **Tech-Specs:** BYOL (Bring Your Own Laptop).

  


**EEO Statement:**



Jairus Marketing provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: Part-Time Social Media Assistant
description:
**Who We Are**



Gargle is a fast-growing, Utah-based organization offering data, marketplace, and support services to dentists in our digital marketplace. As we expand our offering and reach a broader spectrum of clients, we are growing our team with smart, hungry, and curious people.

  

Gargle has a strong culture of inclusivity, engagement and team. We strongly value diversity and drive. We value independent work, as well as collaboration. We provide great pay and excellent benefits, and are located in Lehi, in the heart of Utah’s Silicon Slopes tech hub.

  

This is a fully remote job!

 **Social Media Assistant**


**Pay:** $17/hour


**Hours:** 6.25hrs/week OR 25 hours/month

 **General:**



We are looking for a dynamic, fun, and creative Social Media Assistant to join our Lead Gen & Marketing team. This will be a part-time/contract position. As a Social Media Assistant, you will play a pivotal role in enhancing our online presence across various social media platforms. You will collaborate closely with the Marketing Coordinator to develop engaging content, manage social media channels, create content posting schedules, and drive brand awareness.

 **Responsibilities:**


* Create and curate compelling content for social media platforms, including Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, Google Business, and YouTube.
* Assist in developing social media strategies to increase brand visibility and engagement.
* Monitor and respond to comments, messages, and inquiries across all social media channels.
* Collaborate with the marketing team to align social media efforts with overall marketing goals.
* Analyze social media metrics and provide insights and recommendations for improvement.
* Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in social media marketing.
* Assist in creating and editing video content for social media platforms.
* Work closely with graphic designers to create visually appealing assets using Canva and/or Adobe Creative Suite.


**Requirements:**


* Proficient knowledge of social media platforms, including Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, Google Business, and YouTube.
* Experience with Canva and/or Adobe Creative Suite for creating graphics and visual content.
* Familiarity with video editing software (Adobe preferred, but CapCut is okay)
* Demonstrated experience managing social media platforms for brands or organizations.
* Proven experience creating reels specifically for Instagram & TikTok (please provide two examples of previous reels made).
* Strong written and verbal communication skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
* Creative mindset with a passion for social media marketing.
* Knowledge of the dental industry is a huge plus!


**Preferred Qualifications:**


* Knowledge of SEO principles and content optimization techniques for social media.
* Basic understanding of analytics tools like Google Analytics and social media analytics platforms.
* Ability to multitask and prioritize tasks effectively.

  



If you meet the above qualifications and are passionate about social media marketing, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity to contribute to our team's success!

title: Social Media Sales Specialist - Remote - COLLEGE STUDENTS IN BUSINESS OR REAL ESTATE
description:

title: Marketing Manager
description:
```Job Overview:  
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Marketing Manager to join our team. As a Marketing Manager, you will be responsible for developing and implementing marketing strategies to promote our products and services. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to drive product awareness, generate leads, and increase customer engagement. If you have a passion for marketing and a proven track record of success, we want to hear from you!

You drive sales for the company and profit 10% - 15% of total sale per order/transaction. You’d be promoting your 5% off first order coupon using “Your-Code” to target new customers on any physical or digital platform to drive sales. We should be able to track your sales by tracing orders that redeemed your coupon code. You are encouraged to request access to our social media platforms in order to drive sales. You can use any sales tactics of your choice and comfort to drive sales. You can cold call, email, contact near by residents via mail or email to market the shop. Based on your experience, you’ll eventually be able to request current customers contact to market to our clients.

This position provides a fair opportunity to individuals that are willing to secure a living. Your earnings are based on your work. You are your own boss and staff. You will not be monitored or micromanaged. The more sales you drive, the more you earn. There is no such thing as maximum limit in this role.

There are many sport events around the city, tech companies during the day and meetings as well as parties everyday. You can use your sales tactics to sell Pizzas to these parties. We can provide some sources to contact the customers but you will be contacting them via phone, email or in person at your own convenience. Who wouldn’t want Pizza? Its your mission to find customers, we will take care of having the orders ready and delivered to their footsteps.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $500.00 - $10,000.00 per week

Expected hours: 16 – 40 per week

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Retirement plan

Schedule:

* 10 hour shift
* 12 hour shift
* 4 hour shift
* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Supplemental pay types:

* Commission pay

Work Location: Remote

title: Program Marketing Manager
description:
The organization is responsible for repurposing and synthesizing engaging content using the appropriate digital channels such as literature, eBooks, blogs, videos, web, or social media for deployment. The objective is to present a compelling and consistent brand to our customers and target markets. The Marcom team works globally to ensure our content and processes align with all regions, such as the Americas, Greater China, Asia Pacific, and EMEAI.

**The Program Marketing Managers are experts in these three key areas:**

* **Design campaigns and programs** — create strategic and tactical plans based on campaign objectives and goals for industry and solution segments and product portfolio categories.
* **Marketing mix of tactics and channels** — defining whether reputation, awareness, consideration, demand generation, digital, or other outbound marketing push best fit the program’s requirements. Activities include crafting and deploying email journeys, advertising plans, social media content, and other marketing instruments to support campaign goals.
* **End-to-end management** — Measure the impact and success of the program with the ability to quickly pivot to change the Marcom mix if metrics are not meeting the established objectives.

The Program Marketing Manager role partners with industry solution managers, product marketing managers, and content experts to create the campaign program while coordinating and aligning with other departments such as field marketing. The Program Marketing Manager will also leverage and repurpose content to create collateral assets such as white papers, web pages, case studies, brochures, blogs, and social posts.

**Responsibilities:**

* Performs end-to-end campaign management by identifying the appropriate mix of marketing tactics to achieve specified campaign goals set by the campaign lead.

Optimizes campaign performance by conducting actionable reviews with respective stakeholders.

* Creates a strategy plan for various outbound marketing assets to support the marketing tactics identified across various stages of the buying journey using respective digital channels to increase demand, awareness, and thought leadership.
* Develops compelling content by repurposing existing assets — synthesizing and elevating for top and mid-funnel uses while ensuring editorial quality.

Creates, monitors, and publishes campaign results using visual metrics to measure the effectiveness of the tactics.

* Collaborates with cross-functional teams — from creative design, product marketing, web, and legal to produce effective promotional materials.

**Requirements:**

* **10 month position with possibility of extension**
* **Work Location: Remote- US**
* **Looking for someone with ~7 years experience**
* **Bachelor’s degree (business / marketing)** or equivalent plus four to five years in a high-tech marketing communications (Marcom) role.
* **Experience creating Marcom campaign programs** with successful execution using a mix of digital channels.
* **Excellent English-speaking / writing, communication, and presentation skills with a proven track record of journalistic and editorial content creation and editing.**
* Passion for writing engaging professional technology-based content.
* Experience in leading and managing the execution of processes, projects, and tactics.
* Ability to work independently to prioritize tactics based on importance and urgency to meet deadlines.
* **Excellent working knowledge of digital marketing tools, preferably Eloqua, and content management workflow tools.**

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Salary: Up to $55.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Program Marketing Manager: 7 years (Required)
* creating Marcom campaign programs: 7 years (Required)
* Marketing communications: 7 years (Required)
* journalistic and editorial content creation and editing: 5 years (Required)
* writing technology-based content: 4 years (Required)
* digital marketing tools: 6 years (Required)
* Eloqua: 5 years (Required)
* content management workflow tools: 6 years (Required)
* Design campaigns and programs: 5 years (Required)
* Marketing mix of tactics and channels: 5 years (Required)
* Creates, monitors, and publishes campaign results: 7 years (Required)
* End-to-end marketing management: 7 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Social Media Marketing and Community Manager
description:
**Join Nuvia: A Path to Making a Real Difference**



At Nuvia Dental Implant Center, your role goes beyond marketing; it's about creating connections that change lives. If you're driven by the desire to help others and skilled in using social media as a powerful marketing tool, you're the perfect fit for our team! Here, every post, every campaign, every interaction can be a step towards transforming someone's life for the better.

 **Role Overview:**



As our Social Media Marketing and Community Manager, you'll be at the heart of our digital outreach. Your role is crucial in crafting and executing marketing strategies that not only promote our brand but also genuinely connect with our audience's needs and aspirations. The hours for this position are: Sat-Sun 10:00am-7:00pm MST.

 **Your Impact and Benefits:**


* Be part of a mission that values not just the health, but the overall well-being of our patients.
* Experience personal and professional growth in an environment that supports your journey.


Nuvia is a great place to work! We pride ourselves in the satisfaction of our teams and believe if they are well taken care of, in turn, they will take great care of our patients. Our benefits package includes the following:


* Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Long/Short Term Disability Insurances
* Paid Training
* Paid Time Off
* Paid Holidays
* Paid Parental/Bereavement Leave
* 401k match
* Employee Assistance

  


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Develop and implement social media marketing strategies that resonate with our audience and reflect our commitment to changing lives.
* Engage with our online community, not just as customers, but as individuals seeking better health and well-being.
* Manage and nurture our social media platforms, ensuring they are a hub of positive, helpful, and life-changing interactions.
* Use your marketing skills to drive business goals, while always prioritizing the human element in every conversation.
* Collaborate with the team to create content and messaging that educates, inspires, and motivates our audience to take steps toward a healthier life.

  


**Who You Are:**


* A compassionate marketer who understands the power of social media in making a positive impact on people's lives.
* Someone with a proven track record of maintaining high engagement rates and using social media to drive business results.
* A creative thinker with excellent communication skills, capable of crafting messages that connect and resonate.
* A self-starter who is passionate about helping others and has a strong sense of empathy and understanding.
* A team player who thrives in collaborative environments and is committed to continuous learning and improvement.

  


**Join Us:**



This isn't just a job; it's an opportunity to be part of something bigger. At Nuvia, you'll use your marketing skills to not only meet business objectives but to make a real, positive difference in people's lives. If this speaks to your heart and your professional aspirations, we would love to hear from you.

title: Social Media Marketing Manager
description:
**SOCIAL MEDIA MARKETING MANAGER - YOUR VIRTUAL UPLINE**

**Position Overview**

Do you love creating content and marketing? Are compelling Instagram captions and social strategy your love languages? Are you a dynamic individual with a flair for social media, and a heart for impactful communication? If so, you’re in the right place!

We're looking for a Social Media Marketing Manager who resonates with our core values of love, service, and growth. Love, Serve, Grow™ is not only the name of our signature program, but the guiding philosophy of everything we do as a company.

In our business, love is more than an emotion; it's a guiding principle in how we engage with our community, and each other. Service is at the core of our mission, driving us to create content that genuinely impacts people, and transforms their lives.

We're committed to growth, not just in our business metrics, but in the personal and professional development of our community, paid clients, and our team. If you are someone that values these things, is looking to make a real difference in the world of social media marketing, and grow with a team that cares, we would love to meet you!

We’re looking for a Social Media Marketing Manager who understands that social media isn’t all about likes and comments, it’s about moving the needle, making an impact, creating brand awareness, and most importantly — finding ways to attract and engage our ideal audience so that they become raving fans and customers.

This position’s primary focus will be to expand the reach of our business, brand, podcast, and online training programs by strategizing, creating, distributing, and curating engaging content for our audience through various social media channels.

This is a full-time position — please don’t apply if you have other clients or manage a virtual assistant or marketing agency. You’ll report directly to our Founder Bob Heilig, while also working closely with other key members of the team.

The Social Media Marketing Manager position will be mostly a work from home, virtual position. However in-person collaboration will be required a few times per year. We meet in person to develop our marketing strategy, and flesh out our execution plans.

**Duties and Responsibilities**

Our Social Media Marketing Manager will primarily be responsible for:

STRATEGY

* **Social Media Growth**: Developing strategies to grow our social media platforms both in customer engagement and numeric value
* **Email List Growth**: Developing social strategies that make growing our email list a priority and that promote our list in ongoing social media campaigns.
* **Setting Channel-Specific Goals and Guidelines**: What works on Instagram might not work on Pinterest. Create a channel-specific strategy and best practices guidelines for Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Pinterest, and LinkedIn.
* **Research**: Researching and staying up to speed on new social media marketing strategies and how we can use them to add value to our audience.
* **Determine Important KPIs**: Determine what measurements will be tracked to help us see what works and what doesn’t work, and how our social efforts are leading to more leads and sales.

EXECUTION

* **Campaign Creation**: Partner with our content and marketing team to help support our product launches on the social front. You’ll do this by designing and executing results-driven, lead-generating, and high-converting social media campaigns.
* **Social Media Brand Management**: Act as the brand voice for Your Virtual Upline across all social media platforms by developing and executing a regular posting strategy, including creating and/or repurposing engaging content that establishes our presence as an authority
* **Create Content Calendars**: Create a strategic and organized content calendar that ties into our paid promotions, free community, podcast episodes, etc.
* **Copywriting**: Follow the guidelines of our in-depth brand voice guide and write social copy that matches our voice and feels relatable and informal.

COMMUNITY

* **Community Management**: Owning community engagement and responding to customers who voice their feedback, questions, or complaints on social media channels. You’ll do this *(with the help from our internal team)* by posting engaging content, soliciting relationships, initiating discussion, monitoring comments, answering questions, being highly responsive, and elevating any concerns or arising themes to our customer experience team.

ANALYSIS

* **Weekly Reporting**: creating streamlined, easy to digest, high-level reports detailing top posts, follower growth, campaign success and any other important metrics the marketing team should know about.
* **Tracking and Reporting Analytics**: Constantly tracking and reporting on social analytics and metrics, making suggestions for improvement based on your findings in these reports.
* **Monitoring Community**: Gathering important feedback and insights from our communities on social and sharing with the team in addition to tweaking content strategy to match what our community is asking for and/or in need of.

**Skills, Abilities and Experience**

You are a strong fit for this position if the statements below are true for you:

* Social media is your passion. You can easily spot an effective social media channel and identify the qualities that make it successful.
* You are constantly paying attention to what is working for leading brands and can visualize how it can apply to our brand.
* You embrace a get it done mindset, and bring a positive attitude to all situations
* You are a thinker and a doer. This position is a mix of both. You can come up with strong, smart strategies and you also don’t hesitate to jump in and implement them.
* You understand the power of a good story and you are a master at asking the right questions of the right people to bring that story to life.
* You're an effective communicator, especially in writing. Your grammar and writing skills are top-notch.
* You are committed to continuous learning and growth. Refining your skills and becoming a better version of yourself is part of who you are
* You are a rockstar at communicating with a team, and organizing a team around specific tasks
* You love measuring and tracking the success of your campaigns and growth endeavors. You rely on analytics to give you insight into what’s working and what’s not.

**Salary**: $70,000 – $75,000 based on experience

**Extra perks + details**:

* **Competitive Pay and Bonus Potential** - You will have the ability to earn bonuses tied to the overall performance of the business, and your contribution to those results.
* **Flexible Work Schedule** – This is a work from home / anywhere position. As long as you have a working internet, you can take this job anywhere!
* **Flexible Time Off and Sick Leave** – We believe that working hard and taking full ownership of your role shouldn’t come at the expense of lifestyle freedom.
* **Paid Holidays** – including a Thanksgiving Break and Holiday Break!
* **Birthday Leave** – Never working on your birthday again. Hit the beach or the spa, we don’t care what you do, just don’t come to work!
* **Bonus Potential** – Hard work and smashing goals don’t go unnoticed or unrewarded here at our company. We can share the details when we speak.
* **Learning Opportunities** – A mastermind, summit, or learning experience that will enrich your knowledge in your particular role? It’s on us!

**Application Instructions**

If you believe you are a qualified candidate, submit your application, and someone from our team will be in touch if we think you might be fit!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $70,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Professional development assistance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Marketing and Social Media Manager
description:
* Do you thrive in innovative, fast-paced start-up environments?
* Are you a data and process driven strategic thinker?
* Does your background include experience in both media and SaaS organizations?


If so, we’d love to connect!
  
  

BLOX Digital is revolutionizing the way more than 2,000 media organizations across North America operate with our suite of integrated, proprietary SaaS solutions. From cutting-edge CMS and VMS platforms to innovative apps, smart paywalls, and game-changing digital advertising tools, we're leading the industry forward.
  
  

We're on the hunt for a Marketing and Social Media Coordinator who is motivated, smart, adaptable, and emotionally intelligent. Join us as we shape the future of digital media.
  
  

**Overview:**  

As BLOX Digital continues to pioneer the SaaS landscape, serving the media industry with innovative solutions for over three decades, we are seeking a dynamic Marketing and Social Media Coordinator. This role is crafted for a driven individual with a knack for creating compelling content and strategies that not only resonate with our audience but also propel our brand's presence and engagement to new heights. Your mission will be to synergize with our overarching marketing goals, enhancing online engagement and driving customer acquisition through strategic and creative initiatives.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

* Strategically expand our social media footprint, focusing on core markets to significantly boost BLOX Digital's online presence.
* Craft and distribute high-impact social content across platforms like LinkedIn, emphasizing our B2B solutions and contributing to top-of-funnel growth.
* Design on-brand visual content for various channels including social media, our website, sales presentations, and marketing materials.
* Conduct detailed analytics on social campaign performance, monitor key metrics, and leverage this data to steer future strategies and optimize results.
* Play a pivotal role in social media video production from concept to execution, coordinating effectively with video production units.
* Innovate and manage the creation and distribution of engaging marketing swag and collateral, ensuring efficient handling of inventory, budget, and procurement.
* Lead the coordination of trade show activities from A to Z, encompassing logistics, on-site lead generation tactics, and preparatory sales/marketing strategies.
* Collaborate in crafting compelling sales enablement resources, including presentations, email campaigns, datasheets, case studies, and demos to bolster the sales team's product promotion efforts.
* Oversee paid social advertising initiatives, fine-tuning targeting and budget allocations to maximize investment returns.


**Qualifications:**  

* Proficient with Salesforce and Pardot, leveraging these platforms to drive marketing success.
* Hands-on experience in social media marketing, particularly within the B2B, technology, and software product sectors.
* Deep understanding of social media dynamics, especially on LinkedIn, with a proven track record of creating engaging content.
* Skilled in graphic design with proficiency in tools like Adobe Creative Suite, Canva, or equivalent.
* Competent with website content management systems and a foundational knowledge of HTML/CSS.
* Exceptional project management abilities, adept at juggling multiple tasks with a keen eye for detail.
* Stellar communication and interpersonal skills, fostering seamless collaboration and meticulous attention to detail.
* Self-motivated, results-driven, and eager for personal and professional growth.


What does BLOX Digital brings to the table?
  
* A vibrant, collaborative work environment where your ideas and contributions are valued.
* Opportunities for professional growth and development.
* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* A culture that embraces change, innovation, and the pursuit of excellence.


**More about BLOX Digital:**  

* Stable 35-year-old company that supports the digital transformation of over 2,000 media organizations.
* Offer a truly end-to-end set of solutions for those in the publishing and broadcast media space.
* Mature company that thinks and acts like a start-up.
* 30% market share in the media CMS space generating 6.8BB annual page views.
* A laser focus on new market entry and overseas expansion.
* We recognize, celebrate and evangelize the success of our teams.
* A purpose driven and employee-first work culture.
* We make a difference every single day in the support and growth of local journalism.


**Pay:** $80,000 - $85,000
  
Why Join Us?
  
BLOX Digital offers competitive wages in a dynamic, interesting work environment with career growth opportunities. We offer an extensive benefit program that can be personalized to your needs. Our benefit program includes medical, dental, vision, short and long-term disability, company provided life insurance and supplemental life insurance. In addition, we offer a 401K retirement plan with company match. We also offer generous paid time off to allow the flexibility to balance personal life and work. This includes paid parental leave for new parents.
  
BLOX Digital is a leading digital solutions provider for media organizations across the United States and beyond. Our comprehensive suite of solutions encompasses everything from content management systems to managed digital advertising services, ensuring that you have access to the latest technology and strategies to succeed in today's ever-changing media landscape. BLOX Digital is majority owned by Lee Enterprises.
  
Lee Enterprises a leading provider of high-quality local news, with 75 markets in 26 states that have print, digital and e-replica versions. Our digital sites attract more than 34 million unique visits monthly. We also have a rapidly growing roster of digital products for consumers, and are committed to aggressive digital growth.
  
Lee Enterprises is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We respect and celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. For more information about Lee, check us out at www.lee.net.
  
We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you are excited about this role but do not meet 100% of the qualifications above, we encourage you to apply.

title: Social Media Marketing Manager
description:
**Job Summary:**
================

  

The Social Media Marketing Specialist will develop and implement the company's web-based marketing strategy to promote the company's brand, attract visitors and potential leads, and generate internet sales.  



  

***Supervisory Responsibilities:***
===================================

* None.

**Duties/Responsibilities:**
----------------------------

* Plans and implements web-based marketing strategies and campaigns via the company's website(s).
* Collaborates with web development and design teams; provides guidance on marketing-related aspects of the company's web presence.
* Develops and expands company's web presence through social media, email, web advertising, and other online sources; promotes company brand through these channels.
* Drafts, implements, maintains, and revises online marketing campaigns to drive sales and revenue to the company.
* Manage day-to-day running of all social platforms (primarily, Solex website, Instagram, IG Stories, Facebook, Tik Tok, X, LinkedIn, Pinterest, YouTube, and Mail Chimp Newsletter)
* Stay Up-to-date knowledge of all current social media platforms and trends.
* Capture, create and manage all published content (images, video and captions) across all social media accounts.
* Create visually stunning and compelling content that resonates with our audience.
* Respond to customer reviews and comments across all social media channels.
* Collaborate with internal teams for content creation, including dynamic video content for advertising campaigns
* Proficient in key areas of social media marketing including content creation, community management, and strategic campaigns.
* Craft and implement social media strategies that defy convention and capture attention.
* Event Documentation: Document key moments at significant events and manage the acquisition of content across all events. Stay up-to-date with social media trends and industry developments.
* Coordinates with other marketing team members to ensure active promotions and campaigns are represented on the website(s).
* Strategize and implement lead generation campaigns to further grow the business.
* Collaborates with web design, development, and content staff to monitor and improve search engine optimization (SEO) results for the company's site(s).
* Maintains current knowledge of trends and developments in online marketing.
* Assists with budget preparation for marketing department.
* Performs other related duties as assigned.

**Education and Experience:**
-----------------------------

* Bachelor's degree in marketing, Business, Communications, or related field required.
* BSc degree in Marketing, Digital Media, Business, Communications, or a relevant field
* 3-4 of related experience preferred.
* Excellent time management skills and ability to meet deadlines.
* Proficient with HTML and web design.
* Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or similar software
  

Qualifications


Required Skills/Abilities:


* Extensive knowledge of marketing principles and strategies.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Proven ability to plan and implement marketing campaigns.
* 3-4 years social media marketing experience for companies/brands.
* Insightful and highly creative with the ability to guide and create compelling content.
* Strong blog photography skills.
* Creative and strong presentation skills with attention to detail.
* Ability to work independently and with cross-functional departments.
* Solid understanding of social media /pop culture community trends.
* Remain on top of the social trends and platform changes.
* Some graphic design experience preferred, including Canvas (?)
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
 **Physical Requirements:**

* Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
* Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds at times.

 **Equal Employment Opportunity**

Solex HCM (& Affiliates) provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.


This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

title: Marketing and Social Media Manager
description:
**About Us:**  

Futonland proudly serves customers across all 50 states, offering a diverse selection of urban functional furniture and maintaining a solid online presence. Our mission is to inspire and connect, bringing beauty and functionality into our customers' homes. We're searching for a Marketing and Social Media Manager who shares our passion for design and sustainability and can propel our brand into the hearts and homes of our community online.  

  

**Role Overview:**  

The Marketing and Social Media Manager will spearhead our online marketing and social media efforts, crafting compelling narratives and engaging content across platforms to elevate our brand's digital presence. This role is perfect for a creative strategist adept at blending analytics with artistry, fostering connections, and driving conversations around our brand and products.  

  

**Key Responsibilities:*** Devise and execute a robust social media content calendar across platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, and emerging social media channels, ensuring our presence is vibrant and engaging.
* Utilize analytics tools to track social media performance, report on insights, and optimize strategies to improve engagement metrics and audience growth through testing and new initiatives.
* Collaborate with various teams to co-develop and promote campaigns highlighting our company messages, partnerships, and initiatives.
* Provide exceptional customer care and engagement on social media platforms, embodying our brand values and voice in every interaction.
* Regularly produce and publish blog post and weekly email newsletter that align with our marketing strategy, leveraging SEO best practices to maximize reach and impact.
* Ensure consistency in our online messaging, aligning all efforts with our brand’s values, story, and target audience voice.
* Flexibility to work evenings and weekends, adapting to the continuous nature of social media.

  

**Requirements**:* A minimum of 4 years experience in marketing and social media management, demonstrating successful execution of campaigns that have increased followers and engagement.
* Solid understanding of social media KPIs, with skills in leveraging insights for content optimization and engagement strategies.
* Intermediate proficiency in graphic design tools such as Canva or Adobe Photoshop.
* Strong writing, organizational, and project management skills, with a knack for juggling multiple projects under tight deadlines.
* Autonomous and motivated, proven to work collaboratively, build relationships, and communicate effectively across teams.
* Experience with WordPress and a grasp of SEO best practices for blogging and content creation.
* Comfortable with analytics tools (Google Analytics, Facebook Analytics, etc.), using data to inform and guide marketing strategies.

  

**Preferred Qualifications:*** Over 4 years of professional experience in social media or marketing, ideally within the beauty, fashion, or home decor sectors.
* Exceptional multitasking and prioritization skills, with an unwavering attention to detail.
* Strong problem-solving abilities, excellent interpersonal skills, and a track record of following through on commitments.
* A discerning eye for design, able to maintain a consistent brand aesthetic across all marketing materials.

title: Manager, Social Media & Content
description:
The Crohn’s & Colitis Foundation is a non-profit, volunteer-fueled organization whose mission is to cure Crohn’s disease and ulcerative colitis and improve the quality of life for the children and adults affected by these diseases. Our work is dramatically accelerating the research process through our varied research initiatives; we also provide extensive educational and support resources for patients and their families, medical professionals, and the public. In addition, we lead federal and state-based advocacy campaigns to support medical research funding and improve patient access to care. The Foundation’s core values of compassion, integrity, leadership, collaboration, and inclusion inspire and drive every member of our highly performing team.

 **Position Summary****:**


The Social Media & Content Manager is responsible for developing strategies to increase followers, creating and overseeing social campaigns, producing content, reporting on analytics, and communicating with key stakeholders. Reporting to the Associate Director of Marketing & Corporate Communications, this position focuses on crafting tailored content across platforms including posts, videos, blogs, and visual assets to expand the Foundation’s digital presence and foster community growth. We are seeking a skilled content creator proficient in copywriting and design, with a knack for data analysis to extract actionable insights. This role demands creativity, attention to detail, analytics comprehension, and adept project management. Ideal candidates will possess a passion for writing and relevant experience in healthcare and/or non-profit sector.

  

The salary range for the role is $75,000 - $80,000 per year.

 **Essential Functions & Responsibilities**:

* Manage the Foundation’s national social media channels’ profiles and presence. Collaborate cross-departmentally to create stories and relevant content for target audience segments and key stakeholders.
* Research, plan, and implement multimedia social media campaigns, creating content for each channel and optimizing based on analytics.
* Develop and maintain social media content calendar to build awareness and grow the Foundation’s social communities.
* Produce and publish daily social content that builds meaningful engagements and encourages audiences to act. Contribute to blogs to attract supporters and grow our blog subscriber base.
* Post and monitor social platforms—including scheduling of posts and responding to comments and messages from followers.
Curate content and capitalize on news stories, trends, or hashtag. Working with the PR Agency and Associate Director, monitor news/trends and identify ways to increase coverage for the Foundation. Mine story ideas* - internal and external to the Foundation.
* Lead the planning and execution of annual disease awareness campaigns.
* Track performance and results of campaigns /channels and pull strategic insights from analytics to ensure goals are being met. Create and share monthly analytics/KPI reports for each channel, analyze results, and incorporate learnings to improve future results.
* Identify key influencers and develop strategies to build these relationships and engage with them to broaden the Foundation’s reach and build followers.
* Oversee and review the current process for soliciting patient stories. Recommend improvements for managing patient story bank and ensure that all information is kept current and continually updated.
* Share best practices and train national and chapter staff in social media. Maintain social media guidelines and publish/update staff reference materials.
* Other duties as required.
* Bachelor’s degree in journalism, communications, marketing, public relations, or other communication-oriented study.
* Previous experience with healthcare and/or nonprofit organizations; understanding of inflammatory bowel disease a plus.
* 2+ years of social and content creation experience, including building a following for an organization.
* Experience producing content for the web as well as channel-specific knowledge (blog, SlideShare, Facebook, Twitter, etc.)
* Proven track record of developing successful social media strategies and campaigns.
* Video production/editing skills a plus. Knowledge of managing Live/Virtual Events across social platforms.
* Experience with social media analytics and KPI’s. Ability to produce reports and actionable insights/recommendations.
* Experience with social media scheduling and technology tools such as Sprout.
* Knowledge of project management tools (Asana, Microsoft Teams, Sprout, Hubspot)
* Familiarity with graphic design tools (Adobe Photoshop, InDesign, Canva, or others) a plus.

title: Social Media Specialist
description:
**Social Media Specialist**

We are eagerly seeking motivated individuals with a desire to grow with us and become part of our success story.

NetDriven’s Social Media Specialist requires an understanding of marketing brands with social media. The Specialist should possess a balanced creative and analytical mind capable of leveraging technology to build communities and grab the attention of a targeted audience. This position is responsible for day-to-day execution of client social media campaigns.

In addition, the Specialist will research and identify social media best practices and trends, as well as provide community insights that will be used to hone and improve client campaigns and programs.
**Here is more of what you’ll get to do:*** Researching and creating custom content for multiple social media channels.
* Curating industry resources that may be of interest to multiple social media audiences.
* Manage and execute the day-to-day social media presences for clients on various social media sites.
* Develop and manage editorial calendars and posting schedules.
* Creation and optimization of client social media profiles.
* Monitoring and tracking the progress of client social media accounts; preparation of monthly reports to team/clients on predetermined metrics.
* Use online listening, supplemental research and daily community learning to provide insights for brand reputation management.
* Educating teams within our organization, our clients, and external stakeholders on social media best practices.
* Creation and management of paid social ad campaigns.
* Project management to ensure tasks are completed on time and within scope.

**You’ll thrive in this role if you have:*** Bachelor’s degree in English, advertising, marketing, communications, or other related field(s).
* Hands-on experience managing multiple client campaigns on multiple social media platforms, such as Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, Instagram, etc.
* Passion for community management and understanding of social media best practices.
* Experience with creating and managing Facebook ad campaigns.
* Must be able to demonstrate strong editorial judgement and writing ability.
* Must be able to quickly craft compelling copy that drives social media engagement.
* Must be up to date with current trends in social media and be personal active in the space.
* High levels of integrity, autonomy, and self-motivation.
* Must have excellent attention to detail and the ability to effectively multi-task in a deadline driven environment.
* Excellent verbal, written, and presentation skills
* Excellent organizational skills and an ability to manage multiple simultaneous projects.
* Knowledge of the automotive industry and/or Salesforce is a plus, but not a requirement.
* Agency experience preferred, but not required.


Does this position sound like something you would enjoy and be successful at, but you’re not sure you have the exact qualifications to be considered? While our job descriptions are an outline for the type of candidate we’re looking for, it is not a checklist. We encourage you to apply!

LeadVenture is the market-leading SaaS provider of digital retailing, eCommerce, digital marketing and eCatalog solutions for dealerships across 12 industry verticals including powersports, marine, RV, pre-owned auto, agriculture and more. Our family of brands includes Dealer Spike, Dealer Car Search, Frazer, Net Driven, Direct Communications, Inc. (DCi), Powersports Support, Level 5, PSM Marketing, Monroney Labels, and Interact RV. We are an international company with offices located in the United States, Mexico (Juniper Data Center), Belize (Dealer Spike Belize), India and The Netherlands. Together, we are LeadVenture.

Improper interference with the ability of LeadVenture employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.*

title: Paid Social Media Buyer
description:
**About Tierra:**

Tierra is a performance marketing agency focused on driving profitable customer acquisition for DTC ecommerce and lead generation businesses. Headquartered in Carlsbad, California we are a fast-paced, fun, and ever-evolving creative team that helps online entrepreneurs scale beyond their wildest dreams.

At Tierra, our values define us and push us to be our best. We’re always leveling up ourselves and each other because we never settle for less. We're passionate about our process because we know it works. Where others only see problems, we imagine solutions. We always do the right thing, and most importantly, we enjoy the ride. After all, if we’re not having fun, what’s the point?

**Job Summary:**

Are you obsessed with media buying? Do you live and breathe ecommerce, conversion rates, and maximizing ROAS? Are you constantly immersed in media buying groups, forums, and sharing new strategies, techniques, and ideas? If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you.

As a Senior Media Buyer - Paid Social Media (Meta and TikTok) at Tierra, you'll be at the forefront of driving high-performing traffic for ecommerce and lead gen clients. We're seeking someone who not only understands social Ads Manager inside and out but also thrives on developing innovative strategies to drive profitable traffic on platforms like Meta and TikTok at high scale.

This role isn't just about running ads; it's about crafting marketing strategies that deliver results. You'll be responsible for ensuring that client KPIs and budgets are met on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis. From evaluating creative assets to refining audience targeting, you'll leave no stone unturned in the pursuit of client success.

We're looking for someone who is wildly creative yet meticulously data-driven. Someone who sees every ad creative as a sum of many parts, with strong hooks, problem-solving narratives, and compelling calls to action that can be tuned and optimized for maximum impact.

This is a challenging opportunity with immense growth potential and bonus opportunities for passionate marketers who genuinely care about client success. If you're ready to unleash your creativity, dive deep into data, and drive real results, we want to hear from you!

**Responsibilities:**

* Build, manage, and optimize performance campaigns on Meta and TikTok
* Manage budgets ranging between $1,000-$50,000 per day, per client.
* Budget management on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis.
* Continually evaluate and recommend optimizations to hit revenue goals.
* Manage and analyze performance in Meta and TikTok analytics.
* Generate weekly and monthly reports highlighting key metrics and providing insights into optimizations.
* Use data to drive marketing decisions.
* Support landing page optimization
* Work with brand and in-house creative strategists and graphic designers to manage and meet all deadlines on ad creative deliverables.
* Prepare advertising testing schedules and timelines for brand onboarding, campaign launch, and ongoing account optimization and maintenance.
* Stay up to date with platform updates and trends.

**Qualifications:**

* 5+ years of paid Meta/Facebook advertising experience.
* 2+ years of paid TikTok advertising experience.
* Extensive knowledge of Facebook ads manager and Facebook’s advertising creative standards.
* Strong knowledge of Facebook’s advertising algorithm, audience segments, bidding strategies, and scaling techniques.
* Track record of efficient conversion based campaigns (NOT focused on engagement metrics such as likes, comments, shares, etc.).
* Must have an advanced understanding of split testing, reporting, and optimization for performance-based KPIs.
* Clear understanding of difference between branding and direct response initiatives.
* Excellent writing and verbal communication skills.
* Experience working with Facebook sales and customer success teams to mitigate / resolve issues.
* Experience managing Facebook advertising budgets exceeding $100,000 monthly.
* Advanced knowledge of Google Analytics, UTM parameters, pixels, and conversion attribution.
* The ability to stay humble and check your ego at the door.
* Proactive contributor who leverages the resources and technology at their disposal to solve problems

**Benefits:**

* Compensation commensurate with experience.
* Bonus opportunities based on performance.
* Choice of fully remote or hybrid work schedule (if in San Diego area)
* Unlimited PTO and flexible working hours.
* Full health benefits (including medical, dental, and vision care).
* A genuine focus on employee happiness and mental health.
* Opportunities for internal advancement and growth.
* A team that puts “We” above “I”, celebrates each other when successful, and supports each other when challenged.
* Clients that are dedicated to making a positive change in the world.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $75,000.00 - $100,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Supplemental pay types:

* Bonus opportunities
